models

Class Expense

  • java.lang.Object
    • models.Expense

  • public class Expense
extends java.lang.Object
    Expense class responsible for handling logic related to expenses
    Author:
    Rohan, Leslie, Tracey, Jeremy, Hana

    • Constructor Detail

      • Expense

        public Expense(java.lang.String owner,
       java.lang.String amount,
       java.lang.String tagName,
       java.lang.String date_occur,
       java.lang.String description,
       long scheduler)
        Contructor for Expense class.
        Parameters:
        owner - id of the owner of this expense. (the current logged in user's id is passed in)
        amount - the amount of expense
        tagName - the user specified tag name associated with this expense. (only 1 allowed)
        date_occur - user specified date of the expense
        description - expense description
        scheduler - id of the scheduler used for repeating expenses

      • Expense

        public Expense(java.lang.String owner,
       java.lang.String amount,
       java.lang.String tagName,
       java.lang.String date,
       java.lang.String desc)
        Overloading constructor, used for non-repeating expenses
        Parameters:
        owner - id of the owner of this expense. (the current logged in user's id is passed in)
        amount - the amount of expense
        tagName - the tag associated with this expense. (only 1 allowed)
        date - user specified date of the expense
        desc - expense description

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public static boolean add(Expense expense)
        Adds the specified expense to the db.
        Parameters:
        expense - the Expense object that holds data to be added to the db.
        Returns:
        true if successfully added, false otherwise

      • update

        public boolean update(long expenseId)
        updates the database record with the id using the values from the expense object
        Parameters:
        expenseId - - Id of the expense in the database
        Returns:
        success

      • getExpenses

        public static java.util.List<Expense> getExpenses(java.lang.String accId)
        Get all the expenses belonging to specified user. Used in displaying the list of expenses for the user (not the pie chart)
        Parameters:
        accId - id number of the account from db
        Returns:
        list of Expenses owned by the specified user.

      • getTagSum

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTagSum(java.lang.String accId)
        Parameters:
        accId - user account id as stored in the db.
        Returns:
        the list of summed values of the tag names(owned by the user) found by getTags().

      • getExpenseTags

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getExpenseTags(java.lang.String accId)
        Gets the list of the owner's current expense tags, but only those with existing expenses. Used for displaying the tags on the tag cost breakdown.
        Parameters:
        accId - user account's id
        Returns:
        list of all the tag names that the user owns

      • getTags

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTags(java.lang.String accId)
        Gets the list of the owner's current expense tags. Used for displaying the tags on home page.
        Parameters:
        accId - user account's id
        Returns:
        list of all the tag names that the user owns

      • listToString

        public static java.lang.String listToString(java.util.List<java.lang.String> taglist)
        Given a list, turns the content into a string, with elements separated by commas.
        Parameters:
        taglist -
        Returns:
        the string containing the elements, separated by commas

      • get

        public static Expense get(long expenseId)
        Get the expense with id expenseId from the database
        Parameters:
        expenseId - - the id of the expense you wish to get
        Returns:
        Expense populated with the expense record

      • getScheduler

        public boolean getScheduler()
        Checks whether the scheduler for this expense exists based on the expense id and sets this.scheduler
        Returns:
        scheduler exists

        removes the expense at id from the database
